title: Supervisor de Vendas Brasil - SQM Iodo Nutrição vegetal
description:
SQM Iodo Nutrição vegetal , uma empresa global de mineração e química, possui uma posição de liderança mundial nos mercados em que estamos presentes, o que é possível graças à localização estratégica das nossas operações no norte do Chile, de onde temos acesso a recursos de alto valor, além da nossa rede de escritórios comerciais que nos permite levar nossos produtos para mais de 100 países.


“Desenvolvemos capacidades únicas que transformam recursos em vida e progresso”. Esta é uma excelente oportunidade para pessoas talentosas se desenvolverem como Supervisor de Vendas, que terá a missão de cobrir as respectivas regiões de venda, compreendendo as necessidades do cliente e mantendo relações comerciais efetivas, para assim oferecer soluções que agreguem valor, construindo relacionamentos duradouros e gerando vendas.


ATIVIDADES A REALIZAR

· Vendas e cobertura de zonas: Gerar cobertura nas áreas de maior consumo, aumentando a venda de fertilizantes.

· Gestão de clientes: Conhecer os clientes, agricultores e fertilizantes, e manter relações comerciais eficazes.

· Logística e distribuição: Trabalhar em coordenação com o fornecedor de serviços logísticos para garantir a distribuição dos produtos.

· Cumprimento de objetivos: Alcançar os objetivos de vendas estipulados e gerenciar o volume de vendas em suas áreas designadas.

· Relatórios: Relatar sobre o progresso e as vendas em suas áreas.


COMPETÊNCIAS NECESSÁRIAS

· Formação superior, de preferência em Agronomia.

· Disponibilidade para trabalhar no campo e viajar dentro das suas áreas designadas.

· Pelo menos 4 ou 5 anos de experiência em vendas.

· Familiaridade com a regulamentação de fertilizantes.

· Residência em no estado de São Paulo, Goiás, Rio de Janeiro, Espírito Santo ou Minas Gerais.

· Domínio do português. Inglês e espanhol são desejáveis.


OFERECEMOS:

· Contratação permanente no regime de CLT

· Dias de trabalho: Segunda a sexta-feira

· Local de trabalho: Brasil.

· A oportunidade de pertencer e se desenvolver em um ambiente de trabalho dinâmico e de aprendizado contínuo.


Na SQM Iodine Plant Nutrition , estamos empenhados em respeitar a Lei da Inclusão (Lei n.º 21.015) , pelo que o convidamos a informar-nos caso necessite de alguma adaptação para participar corretamente nos nossos processos de seleção.

title: Account Executive PR
description:
QUEM SOMOS?

A Sherlock Communications é uma premiada agência de relações públicas e marketing digital com consultores em toda a América Latina. Estamos crescendo e buscamos pessoas que compartilhem do compromisso de ajudar nossos clientes internacionais a compreenderem as particularidades e os aspectos culturais da região, além de adaptar sua comunicação para conquistar resultados comerciais significativos. Nossa estrutura e abordagem de trabalho são projetadas para oferecer suporte local aos clientes, ao mesmo tempo em que se integram perfeitamente às suas estratégias de marketing internacionais.


O QUE BUSCAMOS?

Estamos procurando um(a) profissional para se juntar à nossa equipe de PR como Account Executive. Você será responsável por gerenciar contas e projetos de forma estratégica, construindo e mantendo relacionamentos sólidos com clientes, além de identificar oportunidades de crescimento e liderar equipes em iniciativas específicas. Buscamos alguém com habilidades de liderança, pensamento estratégico e comunicação interpessoal avançada, capaz de elaborar e implementar estratégias eficazes. Se você é uma pessoa proativa, com visão estratégica e quer fazer a diferença em um ambiente dinâmico, essa vaga é pra você!


RESPONSABILIDADES:

  • Coordenar logística e prazos de projetos para clientes
  • Organizar e conduzir reuniões de status com os clientes
  • Escrever e editar press releases, materiais de mídia e documentos para clientes, garantindo precisão e qualidade
  • Gerenciar projetos de relações com a mídia, incluindo monitoramento, desenvolvimento de listas de mídia e pitching
  • Trabalhar em colaboração com as equipes de Marketing Digital para projetos de clientes
  • Monitorar a mídia tradicional, acompanhar e analisar tópicos e temas relevantes


REQUISITOS:

  • Graduação em Comunicação, Relações Públicas, Jornalismo ou áreas afins.
  • De 3 a 5 anos de experiência em PR, comunicação ou áreas correlatas.
  • Fluência em inglês; espanhol será um diferencial.
  • Conhecimento avançado em ferramentas de PR, como monitoramento de mídia e plataformas de comunicação.
  • Habilidade em gestão de projetos, com foco em planejamento e execução.
  • Excelentes habilidades de comunicação escrita e verbal.
  • Capacidade de trabalhar de forma autônoma e colaborativa.
  • Desejável: experiência com clientes internacionais ou em agências de PR/Marketing.


OFERECEMOS:

  • Prestação de serviços por meio de Pessoa Jurídica;
  • Fornecimento de equipamentos necessários para o trabalho;
  • Sistema de bônus financeiro;
  • Bonificação financeira para indicações de clientes e membros da equipe;
  • Auxílio Saúde & Bem-Estar com Gympass e outros parceiros;
  • Oportunidades de crescimento profissional;
  • Aulas de idiomas com Abraço Cultural (Inglês ou Espanhol).


O regime de contratação é PJ, com remuneração a ser definida de acordo com a experiência e perfil do candidato.

title: Logistics Cost Control Manager
description:
Location: São Paulo, SP, Brazil


About the Role

The South America Logistics Cost Control Manager will be responsible for overseeing the entire South America logistics budget planning and execution, ensuring financial alignment across operations in collaboration with the Finance Business Partner at Headquarters and the Cost Control team for Fulfillment in South America. This role requires continuous coordination with managers from Cross-Border, First Mile, Last Mile, Reverse Logistics, Customs Operations, and Logistics Planning teams to ensure operations are executed within budget constraints. The manager will also oversee the P&L of all logistics operations, including the Customs Clearance Center.


This position will lead cost control projects, driving billing, payment, and reconciliation improvements, ensuring proper alignment with 3PLs, procurement, accounting, and tax departments. Additionally, the manager will enforce contractual terms, including penalties and claims management, to recover values and ensure compliance with payment deadlines and invoice quality, directing continuous improvement actions as needed.


As the primary financial support for the Regional Logistics Director, this role will provide key insights on costs, budgeting, and financial controls to guide decision-making and strategy. Furthermore, the Logistics Cost Control Manager will lead the Cost Control Specialists team, requiring strong leadership and people management experience. This role is accountable for delivering Logistics Operation Cost-related KPI targets and must continuously generate cost-saving ideas while identifying cost inefficiencies on a weekly and monthly basis. The manager will also lead cross-functional teams to develop and implement strategies that ensure cost targets are met.


Key Responsibilities

  • Budget Planning & Cost Control: Oversee the logistics budget for all operational areas, ensuring execution remains within approved limits.
  • P&L Management: Monitor and manage the profit and loss (P&L) statement for logistics operations, identifying trends, risks, and opportunities.
  • Financial Alignment: Act as a key liaison between the local logistics team and HQ finance, accounting and tax teams, ensuring transparency and alignment on cost structures and forecasts.
  • Operational Cost Monitoring: Work closely with logistics managers to track operational expenses and develop initiatives to prevent cost overruns.
  • Billing & Payment Flow Optimization: Lead projects to improve billing accuracy, payment reconciliation, and cash flow management in coordination with 3PL partners, accounting, and tax teams.
  • Contract Compliance & Claims Management: Ensure 3PL contracts are strictly followed, applying penalties when necessary and leading claims recovery processes.
  • Data-Driven Cost Analysis: Utilize SQL and Python to extract, analyze, and visualize cost data, identifying inefficiencies and improvement opportunities.
  • Continuous Improvement Initiatives: Develop and implement strategic initiatives to enhance cost efficiency, mitigate risks, and improve financial processes.
  • Cost Target Delivery: Continuously identify cost inefficiencies and develop cost-saving initiatives on a weekly and monthly basis, leading cross-functional teams to achieve cost targets.
  • Team Leadership: Lead and develop the Cost Control Specialists team, fostering a strong culture of performance, efficiency, and financial discipline.


Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or related fields.
  • Minimum of 7 years of experience in cost control, financial planning, or operations finance within logistics or supply chain.
  • Fluency in Portuguese and English is mandatory. Spanish and Mandarin are a plus.
  • Strong database management skills, including SQL and Python for cost analysis and reporting.
  • Experience managing logistics budgets and financial performance metrics (P&L, OPEX, and cost forecasting).
  • Strong understanding of logistics operations, including transportation, fulfillment, and customs clearance processes.
  • Excellent ability to align operational and financial teams, ensuring cost discipline and process improvements.
  • Experience with contract management, including enforcement of penalties and financial recovery strategies.
  • People management experience, with a proven ability to lead, develop, and motivate a team.
  • Highly analytical, problem-solving mindset, and ability to lead cross-functional projects focused on cost efficiency.

description:
Na ADP somos movidos pelo seu sucesso. Envolvemos seus talentos e perspectivas únicos. Congratulamo-nos com suas idéias sobre como fazer as coisas de forma diferente e melhor. title: Solution Engineer
description:
About Mitsogo

Mitsogo is a global organization that highly values the contributions of each employee. Our ability to attract top talent is a testament to our commitment to fostering a sense of belonging for everyone. We recognize the rapid evolution of technology and society that impacts our industry, and we prioritize equipping our employees with diverse opportunities and empowering them with a wide range of skills.


About Hexnode

Hexnode, the Enterprise software division of Mitsogo Inc., was founded with a mission to simplify the way people work. Operating in over 100 countries, Hexnode UEM empowers organizations in diverse sectors. Fueling the transformation to a seamless ecosystem of connected tools, Hexnode is revolutionizing the enterprise software and cybersecurity landscape.


Job Overview

We are looking for a dynamic Solutions Engineer to join our team. This role will engage with potential clients to understand their business challenges and provide tailored product solutions. You will be responsible for delivering compelling product demonstrations, offering technical expertise during the sales process, and collaborating with various teams to drive customer success.

Responsibilities :

  • Client Engagement : Interact with potential clients to understand their business needs, challenges, and goals.
  • Needs Analysis : Conduct a detailed needs analysis to align our product features with customer requirements.
  • Product Demonstrations : Lead informative and persuasive product demos, showcasing key features and benefits to prospective clients.
  • Customization of Demos : Customize demonstrations to address specific customer pain points and requirements.
  • Technical Expertise : Develop a strong understanding of our product’s technical aspects and how it integrates with diverse IT environments.
  • Collaboration with Sales Team : Work closely with the sales team to provide technical support during the sales cycle.
  • Collaboration with Product Team : Stay updated on the latest product features and updates by collaborating with the product development team.
  • Sales Collateral : Collaborate with marketing to enhance sales collateral, presentations, and other materials.
  • Relationship Building : Foster strong relationships with key stakeholders, particularly IT decision-makers.
  • Customer Support : Address customer inquiries and concerns during the presales process, ensuring smooth communication and problem resolution.
  • Market Awareness : Stay informed about industry trends, competitor products, and market demands.
  • Feedback Loop : Provide valuable feedback to the product development team based on insights from customer interactions.

Requirements :

  • Proven experience in presales, technical support, or a related role in a tech-oriented company.
  • Strong understanding of the technical aspects of software products and their integration in different IT environments.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with sales, product, and marketing teams.
  • Experience in delivering product demos and presentations to prospective clients.
  • Ability to build and maintain relationships with key decision-makers in client organizations.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

Desired Skills :

  • Familiarity with SaaS solutions or cloud-based products.
  • Experience with CRM tools and sales enablement software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
  • Knowledge of industry trends, competitor products, and emerging technologies.
  • Experience in a customer-facing role, particularly in the IT or software industry.

title: Developer Productivity Engineer
description:
Developer Productivity Engineer #2470


Position Summary:


Our partner, a fast-growing SaaS company known for its IT operations and infrastructure product solutions seeks a Developer Productivity Engineer (DPE) to supercharge developer efficiency across the organization. In this role, you’ll build internal tools, optimize CI/CD pipelines, and champion processes that accelerate product delivery. If you’re a software developer at heart who loves DevOps best practices, thrives on automating workflows, and wants to make a real impact on engineering teams, this is your chance.


Experience and Education:


  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • 7+ years of experience in software development, DevOps, or a similar role focused on improving development workflows and productivity.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI).
  • Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and branching strategies.
  • Knowledge of automation frameworks and scripting languages (e.g., Ansible, Python, Go, Shell).
  • Experience with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Exposure to cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
  • Familiarity with monitoring and logging systems to track and improve developer workflows.


Skills and Strengths:


  • AWS (Amazon Web Services)
  • Auto Scaling
  • Development (Typescript, GO, Java)
  • Tooling and Process Optimization
  • CI/CD Pipeline Optimization
  • IaC (Terraform, CloudFormation, Helm, CDK)
  • Scripting (e.g., Ansible, Python, Bash, Shell)
  • Containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Code Quality Assurance
  • Version Control Systems
  • Optimizing deployment workflows
  • Monitoring and Metrics Tools (e.g., Grafana, Prometheus, Splunk)


Primary Job Responsibilities:


  • Build, Enhance and optimize internal tooling/products to improve developer productivity and workflow.
  • Design, develop, and maintain automation tools for deployment, testing, and code quality.
  • Work with engineers to identify challenges in development processes and propose solutions.
  • Improve build and deployment pipelines to reduce friction in the software delivery process.
  • Implement DevOps practices to streamline development, integration, and deployment processes, ensuring smoother collaboration between development and QA teams.
  • Evaluate and redefine existing build/test/release pipelines (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, etc.) to reduce friction.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the effective integration of tooling and processes.
  • Implement best practices for continuous integration, version control, and performance optimization.
  • Optimize the development environment for efficiency, ensuring that tools and processes align with the needs of the engineering teams.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to the development environment, tools, and processes.
  • Ensure successful adoption and integration of new tools, systems, and workflows across teams, providing training and support as needed to improve productivity.

title: Human Resources Business Partner
description:
Location: Alameda Caulim, 115, Sala 1515, Espaço Cerâmica, Sâo Caetano do Sul


At Evernex, we’re a global leader in third-party maintenance, helping businesses optimize costs and maximize the ROI of their data center infrastructure (servers, storage, and network equipment). With our presence in 165+ countries, over 330 forward-stocking locations for spare parts, and 24/7 technical support, we’re the trusted partner for IT departments worldwide.

As IT continues to evolve, so do we! With our recent acquisitions of Integra, XSI, Maminfo, StorEx (Pty) Ltd and Ultra Support, we’re well on our way to becoming one of the world's largest and most experienced TPMs.


The HRBP oversees all human resources operations and ensure they are aligned with our business goals.

You will communicate with the board of directors and with senior managers to express new ideas and suggest solutions, considering budget limitations and company culture.


Acting as a consultant on human resources management and organizational changes.

This role involves working closely with the CPO to provide advice and guidance to managers on all HR policies, procedures, and legal requirements.


✨ Key Responsibilities:

  • Conduct weekly meetings with respective business units.
  • Consult with line management, providing HR guidance when appropriate.
  • Analyze trends and metrics in partnership with the HR group to develop solutions, programs, and policies.
  • Maintain in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance. Partners with the legal department as needed/required.
  • Provide day-to-day performance management guidance to line management (e.g., coaching, counseling, career development, disciplinary actions).
  • Work closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention.
  • Analyze trends and metrics with the HR department.
  • Resolve complex employee relations issues and address grievances.
  • Provide HR policy guidance.
  • Monitor and report on workforce and succession planning.
  • Identify training needs for teams and individuals.
  • Suggest new HR strategies.
  • Identifies training needs for business units and individual executive coaching needs.
  • Participates in evaluation and monitoring of training programs to ensure success. Follows up to ensure training objectives are met.

title: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
description:
Descrição da vaga


Estamos em busca de um Sales Development Representative altamente motivado para se juntar a nossa equipe de vendas. Buscamos um candidato com habilidades excepcionais de comunicação, proatividade na identificação de novas oportunidades de negócio e de desenvolvimento pessoal, além de ser apaixonado por uma cultura customer centric, buscando expandir nossa base de clientes.


Responsabilidades e atribuições


  • Prospectar e qualificar leads por meio de chamadas, e-mails e outras formas de comunicação;
  • Compreender as necessidades e requisitos dos clientes em potencial;
  • Agendar reuniões para os membros da equipe de vendas;
  • Colaborar com o time de marketing para otimizar as estratégias de geração de leads;
  • Manter registros precisos das interações com os leads e clientes no CRM.


Requisitos e qualificações


  • Experiência prévia em vendas ou atendimento ao cliente;
  • Excelentes habilidades de comunicação verbal e escrita;
  • Capacidade comprovada de atingir metas e prazos;
  • Mentalidade orientada para resultados e habilidades analíticas;
  • Familiaridade com ferramentas de CRM (preferencialmente Salesforce).


Informações adicionais


O que oferecemos?


  • Treinamento e suporte nas técnicas de vendas utilizadas durante o processo;
  • Equipe de “Produtos” e Mesa de Renda Variável para atendimento conjunto de investidores sofisticados;

  • CRM estruturado na plataforma SalesForce;
  • Escritório com estrutura de Alto Padrão localizado nos principais centros financeiros das cidades onde atuamos;

Como funciona nosso processo seletivo?

OBS: Cada etapa do processo seletivo possui caráter eliminatório.


Etapas do processo

  2. Etapa 2: Bate Papo Talent
  3. Etapa 3: Entrevista com Gestores
  4. Etapa 4: Proposta
  5. Etapa 5: Contratação


SOBRE NÓS


A EQI é uma das maiores corretoras de investimentos do país , com o objetivo de dar autonomia para que os clientes possam investir em suas escolhas.


Atualmente contamos com:


  • Mais de 100 mil clientes;
  • Mais de R$35 bilhões em ativos sob custódia;
  • Mais de 500 assessores;
  • Mais de 12 escritórios;


Nosso propósito é potencializar o sucesso (financeiro, pessoal, patrimonial e empresarial), através de estratégias e soluções financeiras personalizadas.


Nossos valores:

title: Garçom
description:
O Hotel Holiday Inn Parque Anhembi está em busca de profissionais que desejam crescer e se desafiar em um ambiente de excelência. Como o maior hotel de convenções do Brasil, estamos comprometidos em oferecer a verdadeira hospitalidade aos nossos clientes.


Não perca a chance de se juntar ao time do Hotel Holiday Inn Parque Anhembi!

title: Senior Salesforce Developer
description:

To learn how we can supercharge progress for you, visit

title: Technical Solutions Engineer - Databricks
description:
Revolutionize Data Solutions: Join Our Team as a DatabricksTechnical Solutions Engineer!

Are you passionate about cutting-edge data technologies and thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment? We're seeking a highly skilled Technical Solutions Engineer to empower our customers to unlock the full potential of the Databricks unified analytics platform. In this role, you'll be a technical expert, providing solutions and guidance to address complex challenges related to Spark, Machine Learning, AI, Delta Lake, Streaming, and Lakehouse architectures. You'll play a crucial role in ensuring our customers achieve their strategic goals and maximize the value of our products.

Make a Real Impact:

  • Dive Deep into Spark: Analyze and troubleshoot complex Spark issues using performance metrics, DAGs, and event logs, identifying root causes of job slowness and performance bottlenecks.
  • Expert Problem Solver: Provide deep code-level analysis and solutions for customer challenges related to Spark core internals, Spark SQL, Structured Streaming, Delta Lake, Lakehouse, and other Databricks runtime features.
  • Empower Our Customers: Assist customers in reproducing and resolving Spark problems, offering expert guidance in areas like Spark SQL, Delta Lake, memory management, performance tuning, streaming, data science, and data integration.
  • Lead the Way: Participate in our Designated Solutions Engineer program, mentoring and guiding strategic customers on their daily Spark and cloud-related challenges.
  • Collaborate and Communicate: Work closely with Account Executives, Customer Success Engineers, and Resident Solution Architects to coordinate customer issues and share best practices. Actively participate in screen sharing sessions, Slack discussions, and other communication channels.
  • Knowledge Sharer: Develop and maintain internal wikis, knowledge bases, and technical documentation to empower both support teams and customers. Contribute to company documentation and knowledge base articles.
  • Continuous Improvement: Collaborate with Engineering and Backline Support teams to report product defects and drive improvements.
  • Be Part of the Team: Participate in weekend and weekday on-call rotations, managing escalations during runtime outages and critical incidents, ensuring seamless customer operations.

What You'll Bring:

  • Hands-on Expertise: 3+ years of experience developing production-scale applications using two or more of the following technologies: Big Data, Hadoop, Spark (mandatory), Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Streaming, Kafka, Data Science, or Elasticsearch.
  • Spark Mastery: Proven experience in performance tuning and troubleshooting Hive and Spark-based applications in a production environment.
  • JVM and Memory Management: Real-world experience with JVM and memory management techniques, including garbage collection and heap/thread dump analysis.
  • Database Proficiency: Experience with SQL-based databases, data warehousing/ETL technologies (e.g., Informatica, DataStage, Oracle, Teradata, SQL Server, MySQL), and SCD-type use cases.
  • Cloud Experience: Familiarity with AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud platforms.
  • Excellent Communication: Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts clearly and concisely.
  • Problem-Solving Prowess: A passion for solving challenging technical problems and a commitment to customer success.

Join us and be at the forefront of data innovation!

title: Field Engineering Specialist
description:
Greenlane Renewables Inc., headquartered in metro Vancouver, Canada, is a pioneer in the rapidly growing renewable natural gas (“RNG”) industry. As a leading global provider of biogas upgrading systems, we are helping to clean up two of the largest and most difficult-to-decarbonize sectors of the global energy system: the natural gas grid and the commercial transportation sector. Our systems produce clean, low-carbon and carbon-negative renewable natural gas (RNG) from organic waste sources including landfills, wastewater treatment plants, dairy farms, and food waste. Greenlane is the only biogas upgrading company offering the three main technologies: waterwash, pressure swing adsorption, and membrane separation and has over 30 years industry experience, patented proprietary technology, over 100 hydrogen sulfide treatment systems sold, and over 135 biogas upgrading systems sold into 19 countries, including many of the largest RNG production facilities in the world. Greenlane is a publicly-traded company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: GRN).


This position will provide specialist on site Electrical and Instrumentation support to Field Commissioning and Service activities. Responsibilities will include the installation, commissioning, maintenance and service tasks on Greenlane equipment as per Greenlane Health, Safety and Quality Management systems. The role will involve working with Biogas upgrading products such as gas compressor systems, level and pressure controls, flow controls, gas chromatographs and gas analyzers.


Duties & Responsibilities:

Health and Safety/Quality

  • Demonstrate a personal commitment to Quality, Health, Safety and the Environment.
  • Promote a culture of continuous improvement, and lead by example to ensure company goals are achieved and exceeded.
  • Participate in ongoing training and compliance requirements associated with the industry.
  • Supervise subcontractors on site this includes health, safety & quality compliance.
  • Adhere to the company's Health & Safety Policy and Quality Management System.
  • Perform risk assessments and prepare risk and method statements.
  • Promote a culture of continuous improvement.


Installation and Commissioning

  • Coordinate and execute start-up and commissioning of Greenlane biogas upgrading plants including pretreatment, compression and upgrading systems.
  • Quality assurance on new equipment including testing new hardware and debugging new software including PLC program, HMI and industrial automation controls and equipment. i.e. VSDs, Soft Starters, Motors and Motor Controls and general electrical equipment.
  • Identify opportunities for product and process improvement.
  • Perform Factory Acceptance, Site Acceptance, and Performance Testing on new equipment and installations.
  • Identify, troubleshoot and resolve issues encountered during Commissioning.
  • Ability to design and/or develop new control systems and testing, maintaining and/or modifying existing systems
  • Provide on-the-job and classroom operation and maintenance training to customers.


Service and Maintenance

  • Provide on-site and remote specialist electrical, instrumentation and controls field service support for Biogas upgrading plants.
  • Troubleshooting Biogas process issues, low voltage electrical hardware and control system.
  • Analyze system data trend logs to diagnose issues and implement solutions on site and remotely.
  • Supervise site services and conduct lockout and re-start procedures.
  • Create troubleshooting reference documentation.
  • Interface with internal and external customers.
  • Generate detailed customer service reports and documentation.
  • Flexibility with working hours, as being part of an on call rotation and call out service is expected.
  • Be available for regular North American and on occasions, international travel.


Qualifications and Experience:

  • Engineering Degree or Trade Certification and experience with at least 5+ years of previous electrical instrumentation/controls industry experience.
  • Strong troubleshooting skills and decision making capabilities.
  • A good understanding and ability to work with Siemens Automation Software and Hardware, Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) (S7-300, S7-1500) and HMI; e.g. Simatic Manager, TIA portal & WinCC.
  • Ability to read and understand the PLC control logic in programming environment i.e. Ladder logic, Function Blocks, Structure Text, SFC/Graph, and work with communication protocols Ethernet/IP, Profinet, Fieldbus, Modbus.
  • Experience using Hart communication devices is considered an asset.
  • Ability to read and understand the Low Voltage (up to 600V AC/ 50-60 HZ) Electrical diagrams and drawings.
  • Ability to read and understand Control system drawings and P&IDs.
  • Familiar and good understanding of Variable Speed Drives (VSDs), preferably ABB & WEG
  • Familiar with ATEX and working in explosive atmospheres.
  • Must be able to distinguish colors.
  • Valid driver's license, safe driving record.
  • Engineering experience within either CHP, Biogas, Anaerobic Digestion, Gas Engines, Diesel Engines, Generators, Power Generation, Waste to Energy, Landfill Gas would be an asset.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral with the ability to work with international colleagues.
  • Great attitude, personable, courteous and a great team player.
  • Ability to work under pressure and stay focused in a fast-paced environment.
  • Must be able to travel through South America up to 75% of the year
  • Understanding of Health, Safety and Environment legislation and requirements.


How to Apply:


We are an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from all qualified individuals. To be considered for this role please apply through the Greenlane Renewables page on LinkedIn and attach your resume. While we thank all interested candidates only those who are short-listed will be contacted.

title: Analista de DP / RH
description:
Estamos em busca de um(a) Analista de DP e RH Pleno para integrar nosso time e contribuir ativamente para a gestão de pessoas da empresa. Se você possui experiência em rotinas de Departamento Pessoal e tem conhecimento ou deseja se desenvolver de maneira generalista na área de RH, essa pode ser a sua chance de fazer a diferença!

Principais Atividades de Departamento Pessoal (Folha Terceirizada):

  • Gestão de Admissões e Demissões: Coleta de documentos, controle de prontuários, envio de informações para a empresa terceirizada e acompanhamento de todo o processo.
  • Gestão de Férias: Controle de períodos aquisitivos e concessivos, solicitação e acompanhamento do processamento pela empresa terceirizada.
  • Gestão de Benefícios: Administração dos planos de benefícios (vale-transporte, vale-refeição/alimentação, plano de saúde, plano odontológico, etc.), incluindo controle de elegibilidade, movimentações, interface com fornecedores e comunicação com colaboradores.
  • Controle de Documentação: Organização e manutenção de arquivos físicos e digitais de documentos de colaboradores, garantindo a conformidade com a legislação.
  • Atendimento e Suporte aos Colaboradores: Esclarecimento de dúvidas sobre procedimentos de DP, benefícios, informações da folha de pagamento e outras questões relacionadas.
  • Interface com a Empresa Terceirizada: Envio de informações para processamento da folha, acompanhamento de prazos, conferência de relatórios e resolução de pendências.
  • Acompanhamento da Legislação: Manter-se atualizado (a) sobre as normas e legislação trabalhista e previdenciária, comunicando as novidades relevantes para a empresa e para a terceirizada.
  • Elaboração de Relatórios: Criação de relatórios internos de controle e indicadores de DP (absenteísmo, turnover, etc.).
  • Suporte em Auditorias: Fornecer informações e documentos para auditorias internas e externas relacionadas a DP e RH.


Adicionalmente, o (a) profissional atuará de forma integrada com os seguintes subsistemas de Recursos Humanos:

  • Recrutamento e Seleção: Apoio na divulgação de vagas, triagem de currículos, agendamento e condução de entrevistas.
  • Treinamento e Desenvolvimento: Identificação de necessidades de treinamento, apoio na organização de programas de desenvolvimento e acompanhamento de resultados.
  • Avaliação de Desempenho: Participação na implementação e acompanhamento do processo de avaliação de desempenho.


Requisitos:

  • Ensino Superior completo em Administração, Recursos Humanos ou áreas correlatas.
  • Experiência prática em rotinas de Departamento Pessoal.
  • Conhecimento em eSocial
  • Conhecimento da legislação trabalhista e previdenciária.
  • Pacote Office intermediário/avançado (principalmente Excel).
  • Desejável experiência com os subsistemas de RH mencionados.
  • Boa comunicação interpessoal e escrita.
  • Organização, atenção aos detalhes e proatividade.
  • Ética, confidencialidade e responsabilidade.
  • Experiência em interface com empresas terceirizadas de folha de pagamento será um diferencial.
  • Disponibilidade para atuar presencialmente na região da Vila Clementino / Moema (3 vezes por semana) e 2 em home office.


Agradecemos o seu interesse em fazer parte da nossa equipe!

title: Leadership Consultant
description:
• This role can be based in Sao Paulo OR Rio de Janeiro
  • Please submit a resume in English


Heidrick Consulting Brazil

You would be part of our Consulting Practice in Brazil. At Heidrick Consulting, we work with Senior Leadership, Executive Teams, and Boards, covering major national and multi-national companies across all industry sectors in Brazil and Latin America.

You will be joining a growing, dynamic team, and in this role as a Consultant, you will continue to learn and deepen your consulting skills by working on various projects. Your contributions will expose you to senior leaders across a variety of industries and geographies.


Primary Responsibilities

The main purpose of the Consultant is to develop consulting solutions as part of client engagements, to write proposals and support business development activities, to act as engagement manager on specific projects and to support Principals and Partners in their delivery.


You will begin to lead, manage, and own problem-solving efforts on a large portion of a client engagement or to lead on smaller engagements. Specifically, you will be responsible for identifying issues, forming hypotheses, designing and conducting analysis, and then synthesizing conclusions into recommendations. Throughout an engagement, you will be involved in discussions and presentations with senior client leadership.


Role Responsibilities:

  • Gathering, analyzing and interpreting data and information; generating insights from analyses.
  • Preparing and presenting information and insights in an impactful and compelling way to help drive client insights and engagement delivery.
  • Delivering a range of consulting solutions, preparing reports and other deliverables that meet client needs.
  • Facilitating and working with client teams with a client first mindset, managing and designing client sessions.
  • Ensuring work is “client ready” (e.g., error free, aligned with expectations, ready to be shared with client) and actively managing expectations with the team.
  • Planning and prioritizing work ensuring team deadlines and quality standards are met.
  • Contributing to proposals (e.g., supporting content development of project design and approaches and case studies) and mobilizing ‘won’ initiatives.
  • Building and sharing reusable, client ready materials, insights (including case studies) and project learnings.
  • Building and maintaining relationships with colleagues across Heidrick & Struggles in Brazil and globally.
  • Contributing to thought leadership and supporting the development of product, tools, and methodologies.
  • Involving yourself in internal initiatives, supporting ongoing improvements of business and employee experience; many initiatives are global and will provide an opportunity to build a global network.


The Ideal Candidate:


Passionate and Engaged: Will bring a genuine enthusiasm for serving a broad variety of organizations on strategic people and talent topics, including leadership and team development, succession planning, Board effectiveness and organizational culture change.

Self-Driven and Inquisitive: Exhibits a strong desire to continuously learn and explore new topics relevant to client organizations and industry sectors.

Entrepreneurial Spirit and Team Player: Possesses an entrepreneurial mindset with a keen interest in contributing to a growing business unit. Brings innovative ideas and a proactive approach to delivering on agreed deadlines and client deliverables.


Minimum Role Qualifications

  • 2-4 years of professional work experience, with a minimum of 2 years in a management, strategy or leadership consulting environment.
  • An undergraduate degree is required.
  • Experience working directly with clients in a professional service, team-based environment.
  • Ability to drive workload independently within a broader team project setting.
  • Ability to manage time effectively, being comfortable with handling multiple priorities and being able to adapt to changing business needs.
  • Demonstrated advanced proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel and Word; easily able to adopt new technologies and software.
  • Excellent communication skills; writing skills with a proven track record of success preparing concise and compelling reports and other client ready deliverables.
  • Ability to communicate, both verbally and in writing, in English and Portuguese. Other languages are a plus.
  • Willingness to travel locally and globally as required.

title: Senior React Native/React Engineer
description:
Employment type: Full-time contractor (paid in USD).

Location: Hybrid (3 days per week). Our office is located near Avenida Paulista, São Paulo.


Why join us?

Handoff is a new mobile & web app for the $500 billion market of remodeling contractors in the US. We use generative AI technology to provide remodelers a fast, accurate, and intuitive way to create construction cost estimates in minutes. There are 600,000+ contractors in the US who could be users of Handoff, and we're looking for teammates as passionate as we are to help us win this market.


The team at Handoff is distributed across offices in Austin TX, Sao Paulo, and Buenos Aires, and includes talent from top technology companies such as Apple, Tesla, and WeWork.


Senior React Native/React Software Engineer at Handoff

You’ll play a central role in shaping the frontend experience of Handoff across mobile and web platforms. Beyond coding, you’ll be deeply invested in understanding our users and their needs, ensuring that each feature you develop contributes real value. You’ll work closely with our design and product teams to deliver high-quality, intuitive, and scalable solutions that elevate the Handoff experience.

  • Build High-Quality User Experiences: Design and implement polished, responsive interfaces for mobile and web, with a focus on usability, speed, and performance.
  • Lead Frontend Excellence: Serve as a primary contributor to our frontend codebase, setting high standards in code quality, testing, and scalability, and taking ownership of major features.
  • Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Partner closely with product, design, engineering, and AI teams to align on requirements and ensure that our frontend solutions deliver seamless, cohesive user experiences.
  • Mentor and Support Team Growth: Provide constructive code reviews, share knowledge, and mentor fellow engineers, contributing to a collaborative, high-performing team.
  • Drive Continuous Improvement: Evaluate and adopt new tools, frameworks, and processes to improve frontend performance, efficiency, and code reliability, always with the customer experience in mind.


About You

  • Education: Bachelor's degree (or similar) in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience: 7+ years in frontend development with a focus on delivering high-quality user experiences.
  • Technical Expertise: Strong technical background in React, React Native, TypeScript, with a proven history of optimizing performance across both mobile and web platforms.
  • Customer-Focused Mindset: You are committed to understanding user needs and using this insight to build intuitive, impactful solutions.
  • Code Quality Advocate: You write maintainable, testable code and champion best practices in frontend development, helping raise the bar for the entire team.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration Skills: You are experienced in working with design and product teams to deliver cohesive solutions, with clear and proactive communication.
  • Adaptability : Comfortable in a fast-paced environment, you’re quick to adapt to changing priorities and balance rapid iteration with high-quality outputs.
  • Startup Experience: Proven experience working in a startup environment is a must.
  • Language: Proficiency in English, both written and verbal.


What we offer

  • Competitive salary (USD)
  • Stock options
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Relocation Allowance
  • Regular offsites around the world
  • We provide all necessary equipment - and you have the option to choose the laptop that best suits your needs!


If you are passionate about building exceptional user experiences and want to be part of a team that values product impact and technical excellence, we’d love to hear from you!


Please note that we will only consider applications submitted in English.

title: Analista de planejamento financeiro
description:
Quem somos

A McCann Health é uma das agências mais premiadas do grupo IPG Health. Somo uma comunidade de especialistas em saúde e bem-estar mais conectada do mundo, presente em seis continentes, e unidas por uma visão: ajudar marcas e unidades de negócios a desempenharem um papel significativo na vida das pessoas. Nossos principais serviços são: consultoria estratégica, educação médica, RX, OTC, DTP, saúde global, PDV, eventos, digital engagement e projetos especiais para o segmento.


Sobre a vaga:


Responsabilidades:


  • Prestar suporte na preparação do orçamento anual e forecast mensal de resultados;
  • Preparar análises e estudos do resultado mensal e suas projeções;
  • Preparar e analisar fechamento mensal, com análise das variações e validações dos números junto com a contabilidade (despesas, salários e receita);
  • Calcular rentabilidade do cliente;
  • Elaborar relatórios e apresentações;
  • Diferir e apropriar receita;
  • Gerar relatório de receita aberta por cliente;
  • Acompanhar e analisar investimentos nos veículos de mídia para cálculo de BV;
  • Atender a reportes financeiros globais;
  • Realizar precificação simples de projeto;
  • Analisar variações de receita por cliente e produto bem como forte relacionamento junto ao atendimento
  • para consolidação das explicações;
  • Ser responsável pelo fechamento dos jobs que possuem repasse de fornecedor;
  • Prestar comunicação direta com o centro de serviços para análise dos fechamentos mensais;
  • Calcular Rebates para clientes;
  • Realizar abertura de contrato de clientes no sistema financeiro (FRC) bem como upload mensal dos números;
  • Garantir que receitas estão entrando nas competências corretas;
  • Realizar análise e autorização de jobs para início antes de faturar ao cliente;
  • Análise das despesas da agência garantindo que entrem corretamente conforme competência;


Requisitos:


  • Experiência de no mínimo 2 anos na área;
  • Graduação em Ciências Contábeis, Administração, Economia ou afins;
  • Conhecimentos de matemática financeira;
  • Conhecimento avançado de Excel;
  • Desejável conhecimento de SAP e Hyperion;
  • Desejável Inglês avançado.


Venha fazer parte do nosso time!

title: Estágio Bilingue
description:
O que é ser GRAND?


Ser GRAND é viver todos os dias movido pelo propósito de "cuidar das pessoas para que elas possam ser o seu melhor".

‌

Nossa promessa está em entregarmos grandes experiências para nossos clientes, colegas e para a sociedade baseada em nossos valores.

‌

· Respeitamos as pessoas pois cremos que ser inclusivo e valorizar os diversos pontos de vista nos fazem crescer juntos;

· Ser íntegro nos torna diferentes pois estamos prontos para falar e aceitar a verdade, honrando com os compromissos, responsabilidades e orgulho;

· Somos empáticos pois antes de qualquer coisa, nos colocamos no lugar das pessoas com compaixão e honestidade;

· Buscamos a todo instante ver as coisas de uma forma diferente, nos tornando criativos, curiosos e experimentando sem medo. Acreditamos que as falhas existem e são elas que nos levam ao sucesso mais cedo;

· Prezamos por um ambiente de descontração, rimos alto e geramos a alegria em nosso ambiente de trabalho. Cultivar um ambiente saudável, alegre e de bem-estar é a chave para um serviço de excelência!

‌

Junte-se a uma das organizações mais amadas e consolidadas do mercado hoteleiro no mundo!

‌

SOBRE A VAGA :


Principais Responsabilidades:

  • Auxiliar o atendimento ao cliente;
  • Apoiar as demandas do departamento;


Requisitos da vaga:

  • Inglês avançado/fluente
  • ‌Cursando faculdades voltadas para Hotelaria ou Turismo;
  • Ter disponibilidade para estagiar de 5 a 6 horas por dia, total de 30 horas semanais;
  • Amar, Cuidar e Servir!

‌

Oferecemos uma lista completa de benefícios:

  • Plano de Saúde para o colaborador e até dois dependentes;
  • Plano Odontológico opcional para o colaborador e dependentes;
  • Seguro de Vida;
  • Vale Transporte de acordo com as suas necessidades;
  • Auxílio creche;
  • Uniforme lavado e passado em nossa lavanderia;
  • Café Sampa: O melhor restaurante, exclusivo para as refeições de nossos colaboradores;
  • Focamos no apoio a saúde mental através de uma psicóloga que faz atendimentos presenciais;
  • Gympass para apoio a saúde física;
  • Day off no dia do seu aniversário;
  • Desconto nos serviços oferecidos pelo hotel (Restaurantes e SPA);

‌

E aí, que tal ser GRAND? Cadastre-se e boa sorte!!

title: Analista de sistema
description:

title: GCP DevOps Engineer
description:
About Wipro

Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs.

We leverage our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, operations, and emerging technologies to help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future-ready, sustainable businesses.

A company recognized globally for its comprehensive portfolio of services, strong commitment to sustainability and good corporate citizenship, we have over 250,000 dedicated employees serving clients across 66 countries.

We deliver on the promise of helping our customers, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world.

· A PROUD HISTORY OF OVER 75 YEARS

· FY22 REVENUE 10.4 BN USD

· WE’RE PRESENT IN 66 COUNTRIES

· OVER 1,400 ACTIVE GLOBAL CLIENTS


Job description ::

The duties and responsibilities of a GCP DevOps Engineer include:

  • Designing and developing cloud systems in line with company’s infrastructure
  • Implementing and managing continuous delivery systems and methodologies on AWS, Google Cloud, or other cloud platforms
  • Deploying automation of cloud infrastructure and services
  • Monitoring, managing and ensuring optimal performance of cloud resources
  • Working closely with the development team to identify and fix issues
  • Ensuring critical resolution of system issues by using the best cloud security solutions
  • Collaborating with team members to improve the company’s engineering tools, systems and procedures, and data security
  • Ensuring that cloud-based systems are compatible with all existing applications in the system
  • Creating and maintaining documentation of cloud-based systems and procedures


Wipro is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and makes all employment and employment-related decisions without regard to a person's race, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, or any other status protected by applicable law. Any complaints or concerns regarding unethical/unfair hiring practices should be directed to our Ombuds Group.

title: Técnico de Engenharia e Aplicações
description:
Na Atmus, os funcionários são vistos primeiro como pessoas, depois como colegas. Damos a você a liberdade e flexibilidade para fazer o seu melhor naquilo que você gosta e causar impacto. Trabalhe ao lado das pessoas mais inovadoras de hoje e ajude a moldar o futuro com a Atmus

.

Estamos procurando por um talentoso Técnico de Engenharia e Aplicações / Consultor técnico comercial para se juntar à nossa equipe Atmus Filtration


Neste cargo, você fará a diferença da seguinte forma:

Atuar como consultor técnico comercial em campo experiente com histórico comprovado de trabalho na Indústria Automotiva (Frotistas rodoviários e fora de estrada) para executar habilidades em homologação, treinamento, gestão de soluções, boas práticas sistemas operacionais. Precisa ter forte conhecimento técnico em áreas como motores a combustão, sistemas de filtragem e afins.

Para ter sucesso nesta função, você atuara no seguinte :

  • Fornece suporte e treinamento técnico/produto aos distribuidores e clientes finais.
  • Investiga falhas de campo e problemas do produto.
  • Recomendar alterações de produtos, bem como treinar clientes e distribuidores em novos lançamentos.
  • Esta posição abrangerá atendimento ao Brasil região Nordeste e ocasionalmente para países da América do Sul e exige viagens constantes na região NE. Esta vaga é para a Fleetguard.
  • Suporte aos regionais vendas em provas de campo para melhorar o relacionamento com os clientes.
  • Constrói relacionamentos para ganhar a confiança e a lealdade dos distribuidores e clientes.
  • Trabalha com a equipe de vendas, distribuidores e clientes para resolver problemas técnicos ou de desempenho do produto que afetam a venda, instalação e uso dos produtos da empresa;
  • Coleta as informações de campo para suportar a equipe de engenharia para responder às preocupações dos clientes sobre a empresa e seus produtos.
  • Impulsione o uso de ferramentas e processos da Fleetguard gerenciando o relacionamento com os clientes.
  • Testa e avalia os produtos e soluções com base nos requisitos do cliente.
  • Prepara boletins de teste de campo melhorando requisitos práticos de manutenção, serviço ou manuseio de produtos.
  • Relate as atividades de forma frequente e organizada.
  • Promover novos produtos da empresa.



Educação/Experiência

  • Faculdade ou universidade dos setores Engenharia ou Administração
  • 3 a 5 anos de experiência na área comercial técnica em setores afins (Automação industrial, Mecânica, Industria automotiva)
  • Nível intermediário em inglês indispensável, espanhol intermediário opcional


Requisitos adicionais

  • Disponibilidade para viajar
  • Local de residência preferencial: Recife/PE ou Fortaleza/CE. Outras cidades da região NE podem ser consideradas.
  • Documentações legal pertinente a função

title: Logistics Supervisor
description:
Logistics Supervisor


The Logistics Operations Supervisor in Brazil will oversee all inventory management and logistics operations, ensuring efficient and cost-effective processes. This role includes managing the logistics team, optimizing inventory control, coordinating shipments, and ensuring compliance with local regulations. The supervisor will focus on maintaining seamless supply chain operations to meet customer demands and support business objectives.


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Logistics, Administration, Engineering or Supply Chain Management or related .

5 years of experience as a Logistics Supervisor/Coordinator is required.

Post degree or MBA in Supply Chain or Logístics or related is desirable.

Advanced English is mandatory (an interview will be conducted).

Spanish Advanced is desirable.


Responsabilities:


  • Team Supervision: Oversee a team of logistics ensuring that daily tasks are completed efficiently and accurately.
  • Performance Management: Conduct regular performance evaluations, provide feedback, and set development goals for team members to improve their skills and performance.
  • Training and Development: Identify training needs and organize training sessions to enhance the team’s knowledge of logistics processes, safety protocols, and use of logistics software.
  • Scheduling and Resource Allocation: Create work schedules, assign tasks, and manage resources to ensure smooth operation of logistics activities and timely completion of objectives.
  • Conflict Resolution: Address and resolve conflicts within the team, promoting a positive and collaborative work environment.
  • Compliance and Safety Oversight: Ensure that all team members follow company policies, safety guidelines, and regulatory requirements, taking corrective action when necessary.
  • Process Improvement: Lead initiatives to identify inefficiencies and implement improvements in logistics processes, engaging the team in continuous improvement efforts.
  • Budget Management: Monitor and control the department’s budget, ensuring that resources are used effectively, and cost savings are achieved where possible.

title: Desenvolvedor Back End .NET JR (Remoto)
description:
Sobre o BS2

Somos um banco 100% digital e focado em empresas, com atendimento humanizado e soluções sob medida para cada cliente - afinal, nenhum negócio é igual ao outro. Essa lógica também se aplica à nossa cultura: temos um DNA inovador que instiga todo o nosso time a se reinventar constantemente. Por aqui, nossos colaboradores (os bessers) podem contar com um ambiente que impulsiona o crescimento da carreira e traz a oportunidade de lidar com os desafios do mercado financeiro com quem mais entende do assunto.
